grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 須恵器【スエキ】Sue ware (type of unglazed pottery made from the middle of the Kofun era through the Heian era)
須義【スギ】cobia (Rachycentron canadum), sergeant fish
恵比寿【エビス】Ebisu, god of fishing and commerce
須弥山【シュミセン】Mt Sumeru (in Buddhism - said to be the highest mountain rising in the center of the world) (centre)
kun reading compounds: 須らく【すべからく】by all means, in all cases, ought to do
